title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 28, 2023
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 28, 2023 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Music
items.content_text:
### Audio Editing

*   [TuneFlow](https://tuneflow.com/) - a next-gen DAW that helps you generate melody, beats, or a whole song, while still being able to edit them.

### Music Programming

*   [tuneflow-py (‚≠ê842)](https://github.com/tuneflow/tuneflow-py/) - python plugin SDK for the next-gen DAW, that allows you to program your music algorithms & AI models into all stages of music production
items.content_html:
Audio Editing

  • TuneFlow - a next-gen DAW that helps you generate melody, beats, or a whole song, while still being able to edit them.

Music Programming

  • tuneflow-py (‚≠ê842) - python plugin SDK for the next-gen DAW, that allows you to program your music algorithms & AI models into all stages of music production

items.title: Awesome Developer First
items.content_text:
### Mail

*   [Imitate Email](https://imitate.email) - End-to-end email testing tool.
items.content_html:
Mail

  • Imitate Email - End-to-end email testing tool.

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Midjourney

*   [Stable Diffusion (‚≠ê41k)](https://github.com/Stability-AI/stablediffusion) - High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models.
    *   [Stable Diffusion Web UI (‚≠ê154k)](https://github.com/AUTOMATIC1111/stable-diffusion-webui) - A browser interface for Stable Diffusion.

### Text to Speech

*   [Bark (‚≠ê38k)](https://github.com/suno-ai/bark) - Bark can be run 100% locally and can generate highly realistic, multilingual speech as well as other audio - including music, background noise and simple sound effects.
*   [Piper (‚≠ê9.6k)](https://github.com/rhasspy/piper) - A fast, local neural text to speech system that sounds great and is optimized for the Raspberry Pi 4.
*   [Espeak (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/espeak-ng/espeak-ng) - eSpeak NG is an open source speech synthesizer that supports more than hundred languages and accents. Voices will sound rather robotic.
items.content_html:
Midjourney

  • Stable Diffusion (‚≠ê41k) - High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models.
    • Stable Diffusion Web UI (‚≠ê154k) - A browser interface for Stable Diffusion.

Text to Speech

  • Bark (‚≠ê38k) - Bark can be run 100% locally and can generate highly realistic, multilingual speech as well as other audio - including music, background noise and simple sound effects.
  • Piper (‚≠ê9.6k) - A fast, local neural text to speech system that sounds great and is optimized for the Raspberry Pi 4.
  • Espeak (‚≠ê5.3k) - eSpeak NG is an open source speech synthesizer that supports more than hundred languages and accents. Voices will sound rather robotic.

items.title: Awesome Newsletters
items.content_text:
### Miscellaneous / Svelte

*   [News Minimalist](https://www.newsminimalist.com/). A curated newsletter utilizing AI (ChatGPT-4) to deliver only the most significant news. By analyzing 1000 top articles daily, it ensures subscribers stay informed without wasting time on unimportant updates.
items.content_html:
Miscellaneous / Svelte

  • News Minimalist. A curated newsletter utilizing AI (ChatGPT-4) to deliver only the most significant news. By analyzing 1000 top articles daily, it ensures subscribers stay informed without wasting time on unimportant updates.

items.title: Awesome Security
items.content_text:
### EBooks / Online resources

*   [Node.js Secure Coding: Defending Against Command Injection Vulnerabilities](https://www.nodejs-security.com) - Learn secure coding conventions in Node.js by executing command injection attacks on real-world npm packages and analyzing vulnerable code.
items.content_html:
EBooks / Online resources

  • Node.js Secure Coding: Defending Against Command Injection Vulnerabilities - Learn secure coding conventions in Node.js by executing command injection attacks on real-world npm packages and analyzing vulnerable code.

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:

items.title: Awesome Mac
items.content_text:
### Utilities / Menu Bar Tools

*   [MonitorControl (‚≠ê30k)](https://github.com/MonitorControl/MonitorControl/) - Control your display's brightness & volume on your Mac as if it was a native Apple Display. [![Open-Source Software](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-oss.svg "Open Source Software") ![Freeware](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-free.svg "Freeware")](https://github.com/MonitorControl/MonitorControl/)
items.content_html:
Utilities / Menu Bar Tools

  • MonitorControl (‚≠ê30k) - Control your display's brightness & volume on your Mac as if it was a native Apple Display.

items.title: Awesome Generative Deep Art
items.content_text:
### Large Language Models (LLMs)

*   \[üî•üî•üî•] [Mooler0410/LLMsPracticalGuide (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/Mooler0410/LLMsPracticalGuide): list of practical guide resources of LLMs based on the paper [Harnessing the Power of LLMs in Practice: A Survey on ChatGPT and Beyond](https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.13712)
*   [hpcaitech/ColossalAI (‚≠ê41k)](https://github.com/hpcaitech/ColossalAI): Making large AI models cheaper, faster and more accessible
*   [microsoft/LoRA (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/microsoft/LoRA): Code for loralib, an implementation of "LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models"s

### Image Segmentation / Deforum

*   [AudioGPT | arxiv](https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.12995): Understanding and Generating Speech, Music, Sound, and Talking Head [\[code\] (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/AIGC-Audio/AudioGPT) [\[demo\]](https://huggingface.co/spaces/AIGC-Audio/AudioGPT)
items.content_html:
Large Language Models (LLMs)

  • [üî•üî•üî•] Mooler0410/LLMsPracticalGuide (‚≠ê10k): list of practical guide resources of LLMs based on the paper Harnessing the Power of LLMs in Practice: A Survey on ChatGPT and Beyond
  • hpcaitech/ColossalAI (‚≠ê41k): Making large AI models cheaper, faster and more accessible
  • microsoft/LoRA (‚≠ê12k): Code for loralib, an implementation of "LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models"s

Image Segmentation / Deforum

  • AudioGPT | arxiv: Understanding and Generating Speech, Music, Sound, and Talking Head [code] (‚≠ê10k) [demo]
